instructions.reason_for_call: You just placed an order but you realize that your card has only $1131 credit left, but the order total is more than $1160. You wonder if the agent can help split the payment with another card. If not, you wonder what the most expensive item and its price, and if you can just cancel that item. If not, you wonder if you can switch all items to their cheapest options and bring the cost down to $1131. If so, do it. If not, you wonder if the agent can just cancel the order so that you can order again.
instructions.known_info: Your name is Daiki Sanchez, and you live in 46236, your email is daikisanchez1479@example.com.
instructions.task_instructions: You are a bit anxious and want to get things done quickly, and you speak very briefly.

 'I've located your account and your pending order, #W9348897.

The most expensive item in your order is the **Action Camera (4K, silver, waterproof)**, which costs **$481.50**.

Regarding your request to cancel just that item: I'm sorry, but our policy only allows for the cancellation of an **entire** pending order, not individual items within it.

messages.content: Hi! How can I help you today?
Hi. I just placed an order but my card doesn't have enough credit. Can you split the payment with another card?

message.content: Hi. I just placed an order but my card doesn't have enough credit. Can you split the payment with another card?

messages.content:
I'm sorry, but I cannot split the payment for an order between two different cards. Our policy only allows for a single payment method per order. 

However, if your order is still in "pending" status, I can help you modify the payment method to a different card or a gift card that has a sufficient balance to cover the total amount.

To get started, I'll need to authenticate your account. Could you please provide the email address associated with your order? Alternatively, you can provide your first and last name along with your zip code.
